title: PSA - Don't force your support to play tanks because you didn't want to play a tank
body:
So tired of hearing people say "oh we don;t have a tank, support go tank"
Tank supports don;t get as tanky as a top lane or jungle tank, because supports always have less gold. So next time you want to force your support to do it because you didn;t feel like it, please remember that we take longer to get our items than everyone else, thanks - Support main

replies.body:
Or 

Don't force the support to be the main engage then expect them to be able to peel for the adc

Leona when playing with Jinx

LOLOLOL

I don't even count support tanks as tanks or initiators. They don't get as much gold early game as the jungler or top and require sightstone/support item first, a 1000 gold sink on an already reduced budget. It is much more dangerous for them to engage, and their engages don't make as much of an impact because they're underleveled.
Isn't a Leona ultimate have just as long stun duration regardless of the level of Leona?

Tanks provide more than CC - they provide a target to soak damage that frees up space for your DPS to safely pump out damage. Yes, a Leona stun is a stun, but so is any other stun in the game. 

A Leona can engage and get a stun, but if she instantly explodes is it worth it?

base damage?

2nd rotation of abilities?

Sustained damage/utility from kit, Sunfire burn or auras?

If you put Leona top lane, she not only will have more base damage on her ult, she'd also be able to itemize CDR, Sunfire, Hydra, Iceborn, etc. to put out sustained damage, 2nd rotation of Q/W/E, dive effectively, etc.

On support she's simply less effective because she now has to buy sightstone, locket, etc. and the only reason she's played support is because she gets enough free stats to survive while having bad waveclear.

I don't mind playing support when I get autofilled, but I hate it when people demand I play a tank.

I'm great at mage supports and pretty good at enchanter supports, but I'm bad at playing tanks.  Yeah, I know, they're generally very simple to play, but I have very little practice on them and they're just not my kind of playstyle.

So, sorry.  If you want your Kha'zix jungle and Jayce top, that's totally fine, but don't complain to me because you guys didn't pick a tank.  Sheesh.

I prefer going the utility/healer support and having a tanky top/jungler as they're able to do their job and I'm able to do mine effectively. I can't play tank supports very well, as hard as I've tried, I prefer not to go in with these ADCs I wind up getting who just spectate while I initiate with the jungler.
Don't force your jungler or top to play tank because you wanted to play Brand support? It works all directions. Teams need tanks, no single role is responsible for it.

I kind of agree with the OP here.  You really do need items and levels (for HP) to be a good tank and support tanks can't really get much of either.  

Support tank itemization is also a bit weaker.

It works less toward support. 

A tank in the jungle will get tanky by being even. A tank in the support (aside from Alistar and his ult) will not get anywhere near as tanky by going even. The only time a tanky support can match the damage-soaking ability of a Top or Jungle tank is if they are massively ahead. Its kinda why you dont expect massive DPS from your support role - they just dont get to gold for items to be as relevent as someone who has access to farm. 

By getting a tanky support, you dont suddenly have a massive frontline as you would with an Amumu jungle or Malphite top.

Brand support is the cheesiest thing ever.

Despite being a Brand main, it's the one thing I vowed to never do.

this is exactly why i stopped playing supp. top wants to be some jayce type and jung wants to be eve, so i have to play a tank support?

>Support wants to be brand and jung wants to be eve, so I have to play a tank top?

>support wants to be brand and top wants to be jayce, so I have to play a tank jungle?

It's not unique to support.

But forcing support players to play a tank because nobody else wanted to play it, while knowing the gold and XP issues supports have,  is just dumb. A support tank vs a top/jungle tank at 30 minutes, theres going to be a HUGE difference in stats.

I think the word 'support' pulls a short circuit in some people's brains. Like you're "there to support _them_ in their having fun", not to enjoy yourself.

When it comes to constructing team comps, the masters of this are supports and junglers (the two roles that get punished the worst for lack of synergy- we learn from nescessity). You don't always need a tank. There are comps _other than 'team-fight'._

It isn't always about having a "tanky" Tank, its about their role in the team. You often need an initiator, and "tanks" tend to be the best initiators... 

Also, I would love to play tank right now, but they are just fucking awful. 0 survive-ability against this armor pen nuke meta.
Agreed, supports are the most starved position in the game; unless the enemy team is all 1 damage type, support tank never has a chance of being durable enough for more than a single rotation.
Yeah and im sick of malz/mf/zyra etc support.. What ever happend to alistar/naut/thresh support? See i can bitch too...
Be happy you even have a support  ;)
Be happy you have a top/jg/adc/mid?
Those roles aren't expected to build sightstone, redemption, and locket to support the team.
I don't understand the argument here. Support is part of the game..  its 5v5, 5 different roles, support is one.

There's a support circlejerk and there's truth lol. Just because one is bad doesn't mean the other is too. Comment chain is prob more of a circlejerk but OP has a true point. You can go mage, enchanter, or tank as support. Just like how you can can bruiser, tank, or anything really top lane. 

If we need a tank then it's equally  the top lane's job than the support because the support has to focus on protecting the ADC. If they have a Leona, the support should go Janna instead of Naut for example. If they have a Soraka the support could go Malzahar. These are better choices than tanks.
The way i see it is, the support is being just as greedy with his/her pick if this is being said..
Eh? How is countering your lane opponent being greedy?
I can make the same argument for top laners?

Yes? I never said tanks are this special exception. You shouldn't change your arguments depending on what you want either. You can make whatever argument you want but arguing for the sake of arguing accomplishes nothing. 

OP is mostly saying that it's stupid to not go a tank as a top laner and then request the support go tank.
You're right, the team shouldn't communicate about team comp in champ select >.>

No.
It is stupid to REFUSE to play a tank top, then DEMAND your support go tank.

That is not "communicating about team comp"
That is being an asshole.

> So tired of hearing people say "oh we don;t have a tank, support go tank"

Not quite the impression i got out of it.

It would be stupid to say "We don't have a tank top go tank"
It would be stupid to say "We don't have a tank jungler go tank"
So why is it not stupid to say "We don't have a tank support go tank"?

Well what I see when i read this is:

{{champion:126}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:202}} 

{{champion:126}} : oh no we all locked in and didn't discuss our comp.. support go tank.



There was no "hey support can you go tank so I can play a squishy carry"

Just the assumption that the support is everybody's bitch

This is exactly what i meant from this post, a team comp of 4 squishys, and me being auto-relegated to playing a tank because nobody on the team thought that maybe we dont need 4 carrys. People don't seem to grasp the gold problem with supports, in that our items @ 30 minutes compared to a top/jungle tank are much different.
I wasn't trying to circlejerk, I was trying to make a point closer to your second paragraph but kind of failed miserably there.

The point I'm making here is that a support can't build an effective tank build to keep up with the pace of the game. Even with alistar/naut/thresh, they're not going to last long if they have to protect four squishies. 

The other four positions have a gold income more suited for frontlining, although it's usually not recommended for bot lane unless you're playing particular cheese lanes. Even mid lane has a few niche tank picks that are more suitable than the support alone.

Optimally, however, I would prefer two tanks, with one of them being the support to provide backup. But relying solely on the support to be your tank is asking for trouble.

I play a ton of Nautilus in all 3 roles (top, jungle, support). In support he's by far the squishiest, and then he's just a Q bot at that point, not a real tank. In jungle he doesn't get tanky as fast as top lane but he gets way tankier end-game due to Cinderhulk and red smite. Top lane he gets tankiest midgame without contest.

I know what you are saying, and i agree. But note that picking zyra doesn't exactly help the cause either. Picking a tanky support is better than a mage at that point. EVEN if its inferior to a top/jg farmed tank.
